title: Museum Notice: Temporary Exhibition Adjustment
content:
To all visitors,

We would like to inform you of a temporary adjustment to the exhibition schedule at the Greenford Museum of History. Due to the unexpected delay in the delivery of several artifacts borrowed from the Royal Maritime Collection, the opening of the "Voyages Across the Pacific" exhibit has been postponed by one week. The exhibition was originally planned to begin on March 3, but it will now open on March 10.

During this period, the East Hall—where the new exhibit will be displayed—will remain closed for installation work. Visitors who had purchased advance tickets for the original opening week may either use them on any date after March 10 or request a full refund at the ticket counter. Online purchasers will receive an automated email with instructions on how to select a new date.

To ensure that guests still have a meaningful experience, the museum will extend the hours of the "Ancient Civilizations" gallery and offer additional guided tours throughout the week. These tours will be available at 11:00 a.m., 1:00 p.m., and 3:00 p.m. on weekdays, and no reservation is required.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this change may cause and appreciate your patience as we work to prepare the exhibit safely. If you have any questions regarding ticket changes or tour schedules, please contact the Visitor Services Desk.

questions.body: Why was the exhibition opening postponed?
choices_text: Because some borrowed artifacts have not yet arrived.
Because the East Hall is undergoing structural repairs.
Because the museum staff requested additional training time.
Because a major event will be held at the museum that week.
